tweets.text:
Our team are ready to provide hot meals and non-perishable items to those being affected and evacuated by #StormChristoph

@gmpolice @EnvAgencyNW @Khalsa_Aid https://t.co/NOfLsBvGrs

What a difference a day makes. 1st pic is at 2300hrs today with 15 #floodwarnings and 20 #floodalerts out. 2nd pic is this time yesterday where we had only 3 #floodalerts out.

Thoughts with those communities in the North West where 2 #severefloodwarnings have been issued. https://t.co/WbYxoVMzsI

Significant snow fall now adding to problems in #Warrington.  To report flooding the @EnvAgency has a 24 hour incident hotline on 0800 80 70 60. Aware of further flood warnings in #Lymm and an liaising with @WarringtonBC #StormChristoph https://t.co/gGbsaB4su1

üì¢ Flood warnings are now being issued for parts of Lancashire, Greater Manchester, Merseyside and Cheshire meaning that flooding is expected. 

For the latest warnings visit ‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/uGQ4g6A5Xn 

#StormChristoph #Lancashire #GreaterManchester #Cheshire #Merseyside

‚ö†Ô∏è @gmpolice & @EnvAgencyNW have announced a Severe Flood Warning covering parts of Didsbury, Chorlton & Northenden as levels of the River Mersey rise. ‚ö†Ô∏è 

A Severe Flood Warning means we must act now & evacuations have started, focusing on those most vulnerable first.

1/7 https://t.co/x23iGk7ydC

urls.title: Flooding - updates
urls.description: The Amber weather warning across the whole of the county means communities across the Derbyshire Dales need to be on flood alert over the coming days. Particular areas of concern highlighted by the Environment Agency are Bakewell, Baslow and Matlock. As always, the big message is BE PREPARED - see the advice on our website.

tweets.text:
The @EnvAgency has placed new #FloodWarnings on River Derwent at #Grindleford #Chatsworth & #Calver.

Residents advised to move possessions & valuables to safety and turn off gas, electricity & water.  

See #flood guidance & emergency contact info
üëâ https://t.co/SHUb8P1Yqc https://t.co/eV3CgrC37f

tweets.text: A busy & worrying day but reassured by visits from @MCCWythenshawe earlier, regular updates from @EnvAgency and just now, a visit by officers from @GMPLongsight, checking in on us by the river to make sure we are updated, aware of evacuation, safety and support. @GMPWythenshawe

Severe #flood warnings have been issued in parts of Greater #Manchester as #StormChristoph brings more rain.
 
Find out more: https://t.co/pSJIL5Vlfz

tweets.text:
#StormChristoph has led to high river levels across the country. Stay safe at home ‚Äì if you do need to head out, don‚Äôt take any unnecessary risks. Check your flood risk before you leave: https://t.co/xNlgwQ9Q4z 

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/NoJbBteLiZ

We have issued a severe #flood warning for #EastDidsbury #WestDidsbury and #Northenden which means a threat to life and significant disruption. 
We are working with the emergency services to keep communities to keep people safe. Updates ‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/uGQ4g6RGOV https://t.co/Ue0KEP0snL

tweets.text: River levels remain high as they continue to rise due to rainfall and snow melt. There are currently 43 food warnings out across Yorkshire. Stay #floodaware and sign up for flood warnings in your area https://t.co/OVBXgMyngb https://t.co/B2Pjo9xR3L

tweets.text:
Heavy rain from #StormChristoph continues to fall across England, with many rivers at dangerously high levels. Stay safe at home. Check your flood risk and what to do in a flood at: https://t.co/V47W2jC8nk  

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/p2kNAPufc3

We are expecting river levels on the River Ouse in York to peak on Friday morning at around 4.6-4.8m. We continue to monitor the situation. Please stay safe and don‚Äôt walk, drive or cycle through flood water #floodaware https://t.co/OVBXgMyngb https://t.co/ZAEZaCPKhb

tweets.text: @phildamb @EnvAgencyNW Yes, these are recurring issues- the completion of the new pumping station in Dallam can't come quickly enough
#StormChristoph currently 2 @EnvAgencyYNE flood warnings & 3 alerts in place for #Leeds. Keep updated and informed at https://t.co/FjsUnQcPZe #PrepareActSurvive

Never seen it as bad as this ... Parkgate Rd & Deva Link closed off and under water ... Finchett's Gutter, the Highfield Drain & the flood lagoon are all overflowing. Two cars abandoned and at least one house under water.
@EnvAgencyNW @cheshirepolice @Go_CheshireWest https://t.co/rJGT2AOLUN

tweets.text: We have teams out across #Derbyshire monitoring river levels and checking our flood defence assets. The #RiverDerwent at #DarleyBridge near #Matlock is exceptionally fast flowing. urls.title: Warrington floods in pictures as snow arrives in town!
urls.description: PICTURES: AFTER a day of flooding problems across the town, Warrington was hit with a surprise snow flurry on Wednesday evening, to add to the problems.

tweets.text: A round-up of pictures as floods and snow hit #Warrington https://t.co/hh5o0fj6yT https://t.co/vsPK67k42I

Please follow advice and stay safe, @DerbyshireFRS are working with all partner agencies to try and safely manage the situation @DerbysPolice @Derbyshirecc @DerbyCC @EnvAgency and many others https://t.co/zXkvsextGy
